result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Todd Hovland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate w/o Consent-Abandon Veh, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary.
Absolute sobriety. No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical provider.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 3:26 PM Defendant Matthew Todd Hovland appeared by video, in custody at the Rock County Jail.  Attorney C. James Fitzgerald appeared by video for Matthew Todd Hovland.  Attorney David S Olson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives right to appear in person in courtroom.  Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1; Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 is dismissed and read in. Court orders sentence withheld, 24 months probation, any treatment deemed necessary, AODA, absolute sobriety, no alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical provider, costs due to Clerk of Court, 51 days sentence credit.
Waiver of right to personal appearance
Agreement to hold open felony plea
